fsm_precondition: Every attractor A must arise from an FSM; no attractor can form outside the FSM solution space.
unique_limit: For each resonance region R satisfying threshold conditions, the attractor A must be unique up to symmetry under Ω.
truth_fixation: Π(A) must be constant across χ and across local perturbations compatible with Ω.
bounded_energy: The proto-energy associated with A must remain finite under χ-evolution.
semantic_boundary: Attractor A must have a well-defined semantic core and boundary: gradient norms of λ and μ must decay outside the core region.
layer_consistency: ρ(A(χ)) must be constant or follow a permitted stratified pattern; random layer hopping is disallowed unless governed by explicit transition rules.
